item.title: Music Playlist - Shopping in the Seventies
item.description: Tramping around the grocery store? Stuck in the elevator? Turn on this playlist and avoid looking at the stranger next to you. (Please, no hate mail!) Songs: Various Artists. Playlist Title: Shopping In The Seventies

item.title: Music Playlist - Jazz, Featuring Cannonball Adderly
item.description: Songs: Cannonball Adderly: Autumn Leaves, Wabash, Toy, Groovy Samba, Oscar Peterson: Take the A train, The Girl from Ipanima, Sometimes Im Happy, Happy Go Lucky Localaka: Night Train, A Little Jazz Exercise, Charlie Parker: Bloomdido, Dizzy Gillespie: One Note Samba, Con Alma, Beale Street, Flute Blues Playlist Title: Jazz 2 Julian Edwin "Cannonball" Adderley (September 15, 1928 - August 8, 1975) was an American jazz alto saxophonist of the hard bop era of the 1950s and 1960s.

item.title: Music Playlist: Midnight Riot
item.description: Poppy, punky, alternative sounds you're probably already familiar with through their advertising business. They're not so far on Wiki yet, but below are descriptions from their webpage. "Midnight Riot is the edgy duo brought to life by soulful rocker Emily Kopp, and guitarist/producer Justin Beckler. Drawing from their love of pop and old school indie rock, their creations feature good old-fashioned guitar riffs, room-shaking stomps and claps, and hooks that sink so deep you'll be humming them for weeks.

item.title: Spring Time. We're Doing Great.
item.description: Today I took the train around town and ran some errands. There's an apocalypse. There were a lot of unhappy people in the streets. Rephrase that. Everyone in the street appeared unhappy. I understand. It's a pandemic. One of my Facebook readers responded to my last post about Julian Assange. Why so serious? What's all this posting about war? I understand. Doom and gloom subjects weigh our spirits down. A politician once told me you can't change the world, you can only squeeze it to get what you want out of it.

item.title: Developing Cognitive Ambidexterity
item.description: Today's motivational video is about the benefits of cognitive ambidexterity, why you should take some time to work on that each week, and how you can do that. For those of you that come here for my emacs posts, don't worry, nothing has changed. I have been working on multidisciplinary studies for over twenty years. I routinely work at several types of activities. These include psychology work, finance, data science, computer programming, writing, and now also vlogging.

item.title: Music Playlist Feature - Le Tigre
item.description: Songs: Le Tigre - Bang! Bang!, Mediocrity Rules, Phanta, My My Metrocard, Deceptacon, Hot Topic, Sweetie, What's Yr Take On Cassavetes, Friendship Station, After Dark, FYI, Gone B4 Yr Home, Keep On Living Playlist Title: Le Tigre The "Le Tigre" sound is uniquely cacophonous, punky, and at the same time invigoratingly rebellious. It's also distinct from their usurp-tuous message, which is somewhat synonymous with that of those rebellious femmes "

item.title: Achieving Alignment Through Communication
item.description: Psychologists do important work, but it doesn't take one to know that people operate a lot like computers. We've got code inside that issues a response when stimulated. The more you know the person, the more you know what responses to expect. In any organization team building improves organizational outcomes. But what is going on when team members bond? Alignment is a concept that explains what's going on. Let each line in this chart represent a person; but more than that, let it represent their psychology, the millions of associations their mind contains between images and expectations, words and definitions, and information and responses.

item.title: Music Playlist - Andy Cooper Hip Hop
item.description: Songs: Andy Cooper: Here Comes Another One - Featuring Blabbermouf, Can't Be Satisfied, Oohs and Ahs, Let The Tiger Out, Have A Good Time, Get On That - Featuring DJ Format, Don't Hold The Feeling You, Last of a Dying Breed, Chasing The Funk, Blind Faith, Bring It To Me, Room To Breath, Intensify Playlist Title: Andy Cooper Notes If you are a fan of swing beats in jazz, and hip hop doesn't entirely disturb you, you might like Andy Cooper and crew.

item.title: Music Playlist - Saki Kaskas
item.description: Songs: Saki Kaskamanidis: Little Sweaty Sow, Changes, Fast Lane, Prime Funk (Extended), Feta Cheese, Globular Cluster, Siwash Rock, Knossos (Remix), Saturnight, Callista, Bulbular Swirl, Fasolatha, Nashat, Powerslide, Amorphous Being, Showcase, Toxic Exhaust, Flimsy, Gore, Bleary Playlist Title: Saki Kaskamanidis Notes Saki was straight-up a monster talent, and humble, and authentic. Listen to his music if you want to amp up your workout, get technical, or kick-it, back in the crib.

item.title: Music Playlist - Seventies Era Jazz
item.description: Songs: Donald Byrd: Flight Time*, Where are we going?, Just my Imagination, Black Jack, Design A Nation, M's, Bossa (Canto G Bossa), The Dude, Places and Spaces I've Been, Lansanas Priestess, Dizzy Gillespie: Unicorn Playlist Title: Smooth Jazz

item.title: Life Moves Habits Tell You Where
item.description: Habits can be bad, like when they deter progress toward your current set of goals, and they can be good, like when they move you closer to your goals or align you with them (if, for example, your goal is to attain a certain state of being). Habits include things like the way you spend your time, the way you think about things, and the way you communicate. They determine where you are going.

item.title: The Bean Machine
item.description: Staying Focused On Being Yourself Here is something to think about. What does it mean to be normal? The picture below is a picture of a bean machine, also known as a Quincunx, a Dalton Board, or Plinko. What happens to the ball when it gets dropped into the top of the bean machine? It gets bounced around right? Does the ball get to choose in which slot it will end up?

item.title: Organizational Psychology -
item.description: Numerous studies have examined what intangible and tangible factors might cause one organization to outperform others over a period of time. There is no question that ideas and talent are invaluable, but it is no longer any surprise that the single most important factor affecting organizational performance is organizational psychology. Here are a few examples: Ray Dalio runs Bridgewater Associates, one of the largest hedge funds in the world. In Connecticut, he's got 1500 people, some of whom are the best and brightest brains in the financial sector, but does Ray cite his PhDs, research acumen, and process as his number one a comparative advantage?

item.title: Characteristics Of A Winner -
item.description: Innovative Hard working Believes in what he/she is doing Focuses on details Maintains a calm and relaxed presence Well spoken (concise…excellent word choice) In-it-to-win-it Responsible Intelligent Continually developing Keeps moving to the front Gets as much perspective as possible Accepts where he/she is at Lets go of errors Genuine Thorough Dutiful Light-hearted, fun Prepared Attentive Implements systems for thoughts and actions Takes action as often as possible Creative Prioritizes actions to optimal Makes time for relationships Presents value and credentials when criticized Expects attacks from others but does not hold this against them Doesn’t take life personally Courteous Engages with different social groups without owning differences Maintains a well tuned psychology Limits unprepared actions Integrates self-checking processes Keeps a narrow focus to maintain effectiveness Doesn’t flinch at criticism (nor own it) Doesn’t spin, stretch the truth or lie Doesn’t sink to a lower level Accepts the behaviour of others with humour keen Discusses what successful actions he/she is doing

item.title: Progress: Getting Along In Life -
item.description: Inspiration is about being on the upswing. Find out what gets you there, find out what keeps you there, and make a habit of it. Success is about a good nights sleep, either tomorrow is Sunday or you are prepared to meet it. Self-improvement is a lifestyle. Expectations are so yesterday. Grey area is dangerous. Make sure you spell it out. Prodigality is tiresome. Habits are the measuring stick you are looking for.
